msgSnippet: Hi Bill, What I did, under my project, I created 2 source folders (src and test).  I then imported my application code into src and test code into test.

Hi Bill,

What I did, under my project, I created 2 source folders (src and=
 test).  I
then imported my application code into src and test code into te=
st.  Eclipse
then automatically created a bin directory where the compiled =
classes go.
Never had a problem.

Hope this helps.  Check out the Eclipse n=
ewsgroups and mail archives too.

Later,
-Larry

From: Bill de h=D3ra [mailto:dehora@...]

To: junit
Subject: [junit] parallel test directories and =

Hi,

Has anyone had any success getting Eclipse to understand a p=
roject 
whose junit code is organized as follows:

   src/
       java/
   =
         a/b/c
       test/
            a/b/c

I imagine it can be done, bu=
t I've not been able to get Eclipse to 
shut up - it says it can't find src=
/test's dependencies, ie the ones 
in src/java

Bill de h=D3ra
